14#ifndef DNS_IPKEYLIST_H
15#define DNS_IPKEYLIST_H 1
16
17#include <inttypes.h>
18
19#include <isc/types.h>
20#include <dns/types.h>
21
22/*%
23 * A structure holding a list of addresses, dscps and keys. Used to
24 * store masters for a slave zone, created by parsing config options.
25 */
26struct dns_ipkeylist {
27 isc_sockaddr_t *addrs;
28 isc_dscp_t *dscps;
29 dns_name_t **keys;
30 dns_name_t **labels;
31 uint32_t count;
32 uint32_t allocated;
33};
34
35void
36dns_ipkeylist_init(dns_ipkeylist_t *ipkl);
37/*%<
38 * Reset ipkl to empty state
39 *
40 * Requires:
41 *\li 'ipkl' to be non NULL.
42 */
43
44void
45dns_ipkeylist_clear(isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_ipkeylist_t *ipkl);
46/*%<
47 * Free `ipkl` contents using `mctx`.
48 *
49 * After this call, `ipkl` is a freshly cleared structure with all
50 * pointers set to `NULL` and count set to 0.
51 *
52 * Requires:
53 *\li 'mctx' to be a valid memory context.
54 *\li 'ipkl' to be non NULL.
55 */
56
57isc_result_t
58dns_ipkeylist_copy(isc_mem_t *mctx, const dns_ipkeylist_t *src,
59 dns_ipkeylist_t *dst);
60/*%<
61 * Deep copy `src` into empty `dst`, allocating `dst`'s contents.
62 *
63 * Requires:
64 *\li 'mctx' to be a valid memory context.
65 *\li 'src' to be non NULL
66 *\li 'dst' to be non NULL and point to an empty \ref dns_ipkeylist_t
67 * with all pointers set to `NULL` and count set to 0.
68 *
69 * Returns:
70 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS -- success
71 *\li any other value -- failure
72 */
73isc_result_t
74dns_ipkeylist_resize(isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_ipkeylist_t *ipkl, unsigned int n);
75/*%<
76 * Resize ipkl to contain n elements. Size (count) is not changed, and the
77 * added space is zeroed.
78 *
79 * Requires:
80 * \li 'mctx' to be a valid memory context.
81 * \li 'ipk' to be non NULL
82 * \li 'n' >= ipkl->count
83 *
84 * Returns:
85 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS if successs
86 * \li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY if there's no memory, ipkeylist is left untoched
87 */
88
89#endif
90
